Your local ACLU chapter is having an organizing meeting on Monday, April 15. RSVP today!

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The ACLU’s Paul Robeson Chapter has been working hard to protect and advance civil liberties right here in Alameda County. Recently, we’ve been pushing for legislation to stem police shootings, restore voting rights for people on parole, and protect access to reproductive healthcare.

At the meeting, we will share updates, create materials to contact our legislators, and strategize for further action.

ACLU ALAMEDA COUNTY ORGANIZING MEETING

Join us to get updates and take action.

Monday, April 15, 7 - 9 p.m.
Oakstop
Osumare Meeting Suite, #304
274 14th Street
Oakland, CA 94612

Sign up


If you haven’t attended a chapter meeting before, this is a perfect time to start. Come eat pizza, learn about the work we’re doing, and find out how you can get involved.

Directions: The event is at Oakstop’s 14th Street location, right between Harrison and Alice. When you arrive, press the #7 and the green bell icon on the intercom to gain access. Oakstop staff will buzz you in. The suite is located on the 3rd floor and can be accessed by stairway or elevator. Phone/text Erika Leonard at 510-334-2242 if you have any trouble getting in!

We look forward to seeing you there,

ACLU Paul Robeson Chapter
